metadata.description: Like most kids, Katie was a picky eater. She'd sit at the table in silent protest, hide uneaten toast in her​ bedroom, listen to parental threats she​'d have to eat it for breakfast. But in any life, a set​ of circumstances​ can collide, and normal behavior can soon shade into something sinister, something deadly. In Lighter Than My Shadow ​is a hand-drawn story of struggle and recovery, a trip into​ ​the black heart of a​ ​taboo illness, an exposure of those who are so weak they prey on the weak, and an inspiration to​ anybody who believes in the human power to endure, and​ to eventually find happiness.
metadata.name: Lighter Than My Shadow
